info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HALIFAX COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 145 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cluster Springs, or near Virgilina, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Occasional cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding in poor drainage and low-lying normally flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... South Boston... Hitesburg... Cluster Springs... and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
